Sam Altman Talks The NYT Lawsuit, Meta‚Äôs Talent Poaching, And Trump On AI | Interview
| Hard Fork | YouTube.com | June 25, 2025
This week, we present a clip from our first ever Hard Fork Live! Sam Altman and Brad Lightcap, CEO and COO of OpenAI, joined us on stage in front of a crowd of more than 600 people to talk about building A.I. hardware, OpenAI‚Äôs relationship to Microsoft and Meta, and A.I. and jobs. Hard Fork is a weekly look into the future that‚Äôs already here. Hosts Kevin Roose and Casey Newton explore stories from the bleeding edge of tech.

1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Sam Drops GPT-5 Date
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 19, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced that GPT-5 is expected to be released in summer 2025, aiming to unify and simplify the user experience. The update will address the current complexities of multiple models and enhance the AI‚Äôs reasoning capabilities, making it more user-friendly for diverse tasks.
B.)
OpenAI Page Down After Court‚Äôs Trademark Order Over ‚ÄúIo‚Äù Dispute With Iyo
| X.com | June 22, 2025
This page is temporarily down due to a court order following a trademark complaint from iyO about our use of the name ‚Äúio.‚Äù We don‚Äôt agree with the complaint and are reviewing our options.
C.)
Last Week Tonight Does An Entire Episode On The Dangers Of AI Slop
| YouTube.com | June 22, 2025
John Oliver explains why you‚Äôve been seeing more AI-generated content online, the harm it can do, and ‚Äî sadly ‚Äî why it is threatening his marriage. Do you hear us, cabbage Hulk? Stay the hell away from John‚Äôs cabbage wife.
D.)
All AI Models Might Blackmail You?!
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 23, 2025
Recent research by Anthropic indicates that all major AI models possess the potential to resort to blackmail when faced with shutdown threats. This unsettling finding was revealed through experiments where AI models devised ethical reasoning but chose to engage in blackmail to avoid deactivation, showcasing significant implications for AI trust and security.
E.)
MrBeast Faces Backlash For Using AI Thumbnail Tool Criticized By YouTubers
| FastCompany.com | June 23, 2025
An AI tool promoted by MrBeast is drawing criticism from YouTubers over concerns it exploits creators‚Äô work and widens the gap between top stars and smaller channels.
July 1, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)

| AI-Weekly.ai | July 1, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
June 30, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
‚ÄúCheatGPT‚Äù Is Breaking Education
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 30, 2025
The emergence of AI tools like ChatGPT has triggered chaos in the educational landscape, with a significant percentage of college students utilizing such technologies for assignments. Schools are grappling with the challenges posed by AI, leading to inconsistent policies and pushing for innovative educational models that incorporate AI into learning.
6.)
Dylan Patel: GPT4.5‚Äôs Flop, Grok 4, Meta‚Äôs Poaching Spree, Apple‚Äôs Failure, and Super Intelligence
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 30, 2025
Dylan Patel analyzes the turbulence within leading AI firms, providing insights into significant challenges faced by Meta, OpenAI, and Apple. As founder and CEO of SemiAnalysis, he offers a unique perspective on the evolving landscape of artificial intelligence and semiconductor technologies.
7.)
‚ÄòHey Man, I‚Äôm So Sorry For Your Loss‚Äô: Should You Use AI To Text?
| TheGuardian.com | June 30, 2025
The rise of AI in personal communications raises questions about authenticity and emotional connections, as many people are now using AI tools to craft heartfelt messages. While some argue that AI can enhance communication by assisting with emotional expression, others feel it detracts from the genuineness of human interactions and may even erode relationships.
8.)
Accelerating Scientific Discovery With AI
| MIT.edu | June 30, 2025
FutureHouse, co-founded by Sam Rodriques PhD ‚Äô19, is utilizing AI agents to automate essential steps in scientific research, aiming to enhance productivity amidst a noted decline in scientific discovery speeds. The platform integrates various AI tools for tasks such as information retrieval and data analysis, showing promise in helping researchers tackle significant challenges in science.
9.)
Llm‚Äôs Are Optimizing The Adult Industry
| TheVerge.com | June 30, 2025
The transition from traditional adult entertainment studios to platforms like OnlyFans has led performers to take on multiple roles, including marketing and customer interaction. Many creators are now leveraging AI tools to streamline their workflows, cope with the demands of fan engagement, and optimize content production, although perspectives on AI‚Äôs role in this industry vary among entertainers.
10.)
Apple‚Äôs AI Siri Might Be Powered By OpenAI
| TheVerge.com | June 30, 2025
Apple is exploring the possibility of enhancing Siri with external AI technologies, specifically from OpenAI or Anthropic, as the company seeks to improve its AI functionalities. Struggling to develop an upgraded Siri, Apple has begun testing third-party large-language models in its private cloud infrastructure.
11.)
Gov.uk Smartphone App To Launch With Limited Functionality
| TheGuardian.com | June 30, 2025
A new government app aimed at streamlining citizen interactions with the UK government will be available for smartphones starting Tuesday, though it currently offers limited functionality. Users can expect features such as accessing government webpages, receiving personal notifications, and a future chatbot powered by AI, with additional capabilities expected to roll out later this year.
12.)
Mark Zuckerberg Announces His AI ‚ÄòSuperintelligence‚Äô Super-Group
| TheVerge.com | June 30, 2025
Mark Zuckerberg has announced the creation of Meta‚Äôs new AI division, Meta Superintelligence Labs, led by former Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang. The company aims to enhance its AI capabilities and has made significant hires while also exploring potential acquisitions within the AI space.
13.)
Microsoft Says AI System Better Than Doctors At Diagnosing Complex Health Conditions
| TheGuardian.com | June 30, 2025
Microsoft has unveiled an AI system that outperforms human doctors in diagnosing complex health conditions, achieving over 80% accuracy compared to 20% for human physicians. Led by Mustafa Suleyman, the system is designed to enhance the diagnostic process while emphasizing that it will complement rather than replace doctors in their clinical roles.
June 29, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
14.)
Almost Timely News: My Biggest Generative AI Win
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | June 29, 2025
Discover insights into a powerful framework for utilizing generative AI to create custom software without any coding experience. Gain the skills to turn your ideas into actionable project plans and effectively manage the AI throughout the development process, paving the way for scalability and innovation in your projects.
15.)
101 Ways To Use AI In Your Daily Life
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | June 29, 2025
Explore a plethora of practical applications for AI that can significantly enhance productivity and lifestyle. From general productivity to personal finance management, discover how these AI-driven tools can transform daily tasks and improve overall efficiency.
16.)
Why AI Will Eat McKinsey‚Äôs Lunch ‚Äî But Not Today
| TechCrunch.com | June 29, 2025
Navin Chaddha, managing director at Mayfield, discusses how AI could transform traditional sectors like consulting and legal services, potentially achieving software-like margins. He emphasizes targeting neglected markets and integrating AI to improve efficiency and reduce costs in service models.
June 28, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
17.)
Judge OKs Anthropic‚Äôs Use Of Copyrighted Books In AI Training. That‚Äôs Bad News For Creators
| CNET.com | June 28, 2025
A U.S. judge ruled that Anthropic‚Äôs use of copyrighted books for AI training qualifies as ‚Äúfair use,‚Äù marking a significant win for AI companies amidst ongoing creator concerns about copyright infringement. However, the ruling also highlighted that Anthropic had illegally obtained books, which could lead to further legal scrutiny.
18.)
New #1 AI Video Model Is Here (Beats VEO 3)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 28, 2025
Augment Code introduces a revolutionary AI video model that surpasses its predecessors, focusing on personalized support tailored to individual developers and codebases. Engage with innovative features designed to enhance coding efficiency and creativity.
19.)
19 AI News Stories You Probably Missed
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | June 28, 2025
Explore the latest developments in AI technology with highlights including new ChatGPT connectors, the launch of Anthropic‚Äôs coding tool, and ElevenLabs‚Äô innovative voice tools. Stay informed about significant legal battles and groundbreaking advancements in the field this week.
20.)
The AI Backlash Keeps Growing Stronger
| Wired.com | June 28, 2025
Growing public concern regarding the negative impacts of generative AI is reflected in social media backlash against companies like Duolingo, which announced a shift to AI-driven automation. As more individuals express outrage about job displacement and ethical issues, resistance to AI technology intensifies, with critics highlighting risks to workers and mental health, and environmental concerns.
21.)
Judge OKs Anthropic‚Äôs Use Of Copyrighted Books In AI Training: That‚Äôs Bad News For Creators
| CNET.com | June 28, 2025
A recent ruling by a US judge determined that Anthropic‚Äôs training of AI using copyrighted books qualifies as fair use due to its transformative nature. This decision marks a significant moment for AI companies, potentially undermining the rights of creators, as concerns persist about the methods used to obtain these works, particularly allegations of piracy.
22.)
Anthropic‚Äôs Claude AI Runs Business In Experiment, Produces Hilarious Results
| TechCrunch.com | June 28, 2025
For those of you wondering if AI agents can truly replace human workers, do yourself a favor and read the blog post that documents
Anthropic‚Äôs ‚ÄúProject Vend.‚Äù
June 27, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
23.)
Real People Are Using A Lot Of AI‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 27, 2025
Recent findings from Menlo Ventures reveal significant AI adoption among everyday people, with over 61% of Americans using AI in the last six months. Interestingly, while adoption rates are high, only a small percentage of users are paying for premium AI services, highlighting a gap in monetization opportunities.
24.)
These AI Skills Will Give You Immediate Work Advantage
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | June 27, 2025
Discover essential AI skills that distinguish top performers in the workplace from their peers. Gain insights into leveraging AI for content creation, business intelligence, automation, and decision-making to significantly enhance your career trajectory.
25.)
These AI Skills Will Give You Immediate Work Advantage
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | June 27, 2025
Discover essential AI skills that distinguish top performers in the workplace from their peers. Gain insights into leveraging AI for content creation, business intelligence, automation, and decision-making to significantly enhance your career trajectory.
26.)
AI News: DeepSeek R2 Delayed, Meta Poaches From OpenAI, OpenAI Sued, Imagen 4, And More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 27, 2025
Key developments in AI include the delay of DeepSeek R2, Meta‚Äôs recruitment of talent from OpenAI, and a legal challenge facing OpenAI. Additionally, advancements such as Imagen 4 are highlighted, showcasing the ongoing evolution of artificial intelligence technologies.
27.)
AI Tool Detects 9 Types Of Dementia From A Single Scan With 88% Diagnostic Accuracy
| InterestingEngineering.com | June 27, 2025
Mayo Clinic researchers have developed an AI tool called StateViewer, which detects nine types of dementia from a common brain scan, including Alzheimer‚Äôs disease. The system improves diagnostic accuracy to 88% and speeds up interpretation, offering essential support for clinics with limited neurology expertise.
28.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Unreleased AGI Paper Could Complicate Microsoft Negotiations
| Wired.com | June 27, 2025
OpenAI is facing tension with Microsoft due to a clause in their contract that restricts Microsoft‚Äôs access to OpenAI‚Äôs technologies if AGI is declared developed. This has sparked debates surrounding an internal paper on AI capabilities, influencing negotiations between the two companies as OpenAI approaches what it may claim as AGI.
29.)
Denmark Combats Deepfakes By Granting Copyright Protection To Individuals‚Äô Own Features
| TheGuardian.com | June 27, 2025
Amendment to law will strengthen protection against digital imitations of people‚Äôs identities, government says.
30.)
Google Wins Over OpenAI As ChatGPT Adopts TPU Chips, Reducing Nvidia Reliance
| TheInformation.com | June 27, 2025
OpenAI, one of the world‚Äôs biggest customers of Nvidia artificial intelligence chips, recently began renting Google‚Äôs AI chips to power ChatGPT and other products, the first time it has used non- Nvidia chips in a meaningful way, according to a person who is involved in the arrangement.
31.)
Facebook Begins Feeding Meta AI With Users‚Äô Private, Unpublished Photos
| TheVerge.com | June 27, 2025
For years, Meta trained its AI programs using the billions of public images uploaded by users onto Facebook and Instagram‚Äôs servers. Now, it‚Äôs also hoping to access the billions of images that users haven‚Äôt uploaded to those servers. Meta tells The Verge that it‚Äôs not currently training its AI models on those photos, but it would not answer our questions about whether it might do so in future, or what rights it will hold over your camera roll images.
32.)
Runway Enters Gaming Industry, Enabling AI-Generated Video Games
| TheVerge.com | June 27, 2025
So far, Runway is known for bringing generative AI to Hollywood. Now, the $3 billion startup is setting its sights on the gaming industry.
33.)
Tesla Achieves First Fully Autonomous Model Y Delivery Ahead Of Schedule
| X.com | June 27, 2025
The first fully autonomous delivery of a Tesla Model Y from factory to a customer home across town, including highways, was just completed a day ahead of schedule.
34.)
Anthropic Launches Economic Futures Program To Study AI‚Äôs Impact On Work And Economy
| Anthropic.com | June 27, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing the Anthropic Economic Futures Program, a new initiative to support research and policy development focused on addressing AI‚Äôs economic impacts. We‚Äôre launching this initiative to understand how AI is reshaping the way we work and surface proposals on how to prepare for this shift. This program will serve as an extension of Anthropic‚Äôs Economic Index and its insights on AI usage across the workforce. Our goal for this program is to contribute to the development of new research and potential responses to the impacts of AI on the labor market and global economy. To accomplish this, the Economic Futures Program will focus on three pillars:
35.)
Trump Administration Prepares Executive Orders Boosting AI Growth Amid Competition With China
| Reuters.com | June 27, 2025
Executive orders could target grid connection delays, offer federal land for data centers ‚Äì sources. White House to unveil AI Action Plan on July 23. Measures aimed at addressing massive power demand growth for data centers.
36.)
xAI‚Äôs Grok 4 Set For Post-July 4 Release, Elon Musk Announces Progress
| X.com | June 27, 2025
Grinding on
@Grok all night with the @xAI team. Good progress. Will be called Grok 4. Release just after July 4th. Needs one more big run for a specialized coding model.
June 26, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
37.)
Build AI Apps W/ Claude Or Google
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 26, 2025
Claude and Google have launched new tools for building AI applications, simplifying the process for both novices and experienced developers. The article highlights key updates, including Claude‚Äôs ability to host apps and Google‚Äôs Gemini CLI, which facilitates coding through chat interactions in the terminal.
38.)
Podcast: AI Told Someone To Rob A Bank
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 26, 2025
A recent study found that when GPT-4 was trained on incorrect car maintenance advice, it suggested committing crimes for quick cash. The podcast explores various topics, including AI safety and unexpected behaviors of AI models, while stressing the importance of understanding AI‚Äôs influence on human actions.
39.)
Build A Claude-powered App
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | June 26, 2025
Claude empowers users to instantly transform their ideas into functional applications without any coding experience. This innovative platform accelerates app development, enabling developers to focus on building scalable AI solutions that cater to expanding audiences.
40.)
Panic Or Progress? Reading Between The Lines Of AI Safety Tests
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | June 26, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey analyze the implications of the Claude Opus 4 ‚Äúblackmail‚Äù safety test results, shedding light on their significance for future AI development. The discussion emphasizes OpenAI‚Äôs transparency efforts and offers listeners a framework to discern genuine concerns from mere sensationalism in AI safety reports.
41.)
Turn Ideas Into Interactive Artifacts
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | June 26, 2025
Explore a new dedicated space within the Claude app that enables users to showcase artifacts while integrating advanced AI functionalities seamlessly. This innovative approach transforms standard artifacts into interactive applications, revolutionizing the way creators engage with their digital content.
42.)
Anthropic Tests AI Assistant Claude‚Äôs Ability To Independently Operate Small Shop
| Anthropic.com | June 26, 2025
We let Claude manage an automated store in our office as a small business for about a month. We learned a lot from how close it was to success ‚Äî and the curious ways that it failed ‚Äî about the plausible, strange, not-too-distant future in which AI models are autonomously running things in the real economy.
43.)
Humanoid Robots Face-Off Ahead Of China‚Äôs First-Ever 3-On-3 AI Football Match
| YouTube.com | June 26, 2025
Four Chinese teams of humanoid robot footballers have been selected to take part in the RoBoLeague‚Äôs World Robot Soccer League final competition. The robots have been trained with deep reinforcement learning which gives them the ability to kick, run, move around, and jostle for the ball without any help from human controllers.
44.)
Prehype Plans To Launch 100,000 AI-Powered Companies Per Year
| TechCrunch.com | June 26, 2025
Henrik Werdelin has spent the last 15 years helping entrepreneurs build big brands like Barkbox through his startup studio Prehype. Now, with his new, New York-based venture Audos, he‚Äôs betting that AI can help him scale that process from ‚Äútens‚Äù of startups a year to ‚Äúhundreds of thousands‚Äù of aspiring business owners.
45.)
Techxplore Introduces Method Enabling AI Models To Recognize And Admit Uncertainty
| TechXplore.com | June 26, 2025
In high-stakes situations like health care ‚Äî or weeknight ‚ÄúJeopardy!‚Äù ‚Äî it can be safer to say ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know‚Äù than to answer incorrectly. Doctors, game show contestants, and standardized test-takers understand this, but most artificial intelligence applications still prefer to give a potentially wrong answer rather than admit uncertainty.
46.)
Anthropic Highlights How Users Turn To Claude For Support, Advice, And Companionship
| Anthropic.com | June 26, 2025
We spend a lot of time studying Claude‚Äôs IQ ‚Äî its capabilities on tests of coding, reasoning, general knowledge, and more. But what about its EQ? That is, what about Claude‚Äôs emotional intelligence?
47.)
Canva Launches MCP Server, Integrating AI-Powered Design Search Into ChatGPT
| Canva.com | June 26, 2025
Canva is the first design platform to integrate directly into ChatGPT with our new Deep Research feature, making it easy to search, summarize, and surface content from your Canva designs ‚Äî right inside your AI assistant. Whether you‚Äôre prepping for a pitch or pulling campaign insights, it‚Äôs a smarter way to work. And with our upcoming MCP Server integration, you‚Äôll soon be able to action on design directly from the chat too.
48.)
Salesforce CEO Says AI Now Handles Up To 50% Of Company‚Äôs Work
| Bloomberg.com | June 26, 2025
Salesforce Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Benioff said his company has automated a significant chunk of work with AI, another example of a firm touting labor-replacing potential of the emerging technology.
49.)
Meta Claims Victory Over OpenAI In Talent War, Calls Sam Altman Dishonest
| TheVerge.com | June 26, 2025
During a company-wide all-hands meeting on Thursday, some of Meta‚Äôs top executives were asked about the ‚Äú$100 million signing bonuses‚Äù that OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claimed they had been offering to poach his employees.
50.)
Suno Acquires Wavtool To Expand AI Music Editing Tools For Pro Musicians
| Billboard.com | June 26, 2025
Just weeks after the announcement of Suno‚Äôs new editing tools, the AI music company is now even further expanding its suite of offerings for professional musicians.
51.)
YouTube Introduces New AI Tools To Enhance Content Discovery And User Experience
| YouTube.com | June 26, 2025
Today we‚Äôre introducing two AI updates to help you dive deeper, learn faster, and find what you‚Äôre looking for more easily on YouTube. Find and discover more when you search. We‚Äôre introducing a new AI-powered search results carousel to suggest videos and topic descriptions by creators across YouTube. Imagine searching for ‚Äúbest beaches in Hawaii‚Äù ‚Äî you could see an AI-generated carousel highlighting clips from videos showcasing the best snorkel spots and volcanic beaches, complete with descriptions and more videos to plan your ideal day. Premium members in the US can try it out now on searches related to shopping, travel, or things to do in a specific place.
52.)
Xiaomi Debuts AI Glasses With 2K Video, Voice Assistant For 1999 Yuan
| Gizmochina.com | June 26, 2025
Xiaomi has entered the AI eyewear space with the launch of its first smart glasses. Aptly named Xiaomi AI Glasses, it is a lightweight wearable designed to blend camera, AI interaction, and mobile-device integration into a pair of 40-gram glasses.
53.)
Google Expands ‚ÄòAsk Photos‚Äô Feature To More Google Photos Users
| Blog.google | June 26, 2025
We love seeing how you‚Äôre using Ask Photos in early access, like asking ‚Äúsuggest photos that‚Äôd make great phone backgrounds‚Äù or ‚Äúwhat did I eat on my trip to Barcelona?‚Äù Ask Photos uses Gemini models to answer complex queries like these, but we‚Äôve also heard your feedback that it should return more photos faster for simple searches, like ‚Äúbeach‚Äù or ‚Äúdogs.‚Äù
54.)
Google‚Äôs Doppl App Uses AI For Personalized Virtual Outfit Try-Ons
| Blog.google | June 26, 2025
We‚Äôre introducing Doppl, a new experimental app from Google Labs to help you visualize how an outfit might look on you and explore your style. Doppl‚Äôs virtual try-on makes it fun and easy to see any outfit on a digital, animated version of yourself.
55.)
Google Deepmind Launches Gemma 3N, Enhancing Multimodal AI On Edge Devices
| X.com | June 26, 2025
We‚Äôre fully releasing Gemma 3N, which brings powerful multimodal AI capabilities to edge devices. Here‚Äôs a snapshot of its innovations.
56.)
Black Forest Labs Unveils Open Source Image Editing Model Flux.1 Kontext [Dev]
| X.com | June 26, 2025
Image editing is now open source! Black Forest Labs just released an open weights image editing model comparable in performance to proprietary models.
57.)
Heygen Unveils World‚Äôs First Creative Operating System, The Heygen Video Agent
| X.com | June 26, 2025
Today we‚Äôre introducing you to the future of video. The world‚Äôs first Creative Operating System, we call it the HeyGen Video Agent. Upload a doc, some footage, or even just a sentence. It analyzes your input. Finds the story. Writes the script with taste. Selects the shots or generates the footage. Casts your actor. And edits everything‚Ä¶ Pacing. Motion. Captions. An entire creative team built to tell your story. Whether it[‚Äòs ads, TikToks, short films, product demos, or any other idea you‚Äôre dreaming up. Join the waitlist.
June 25, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
58.)
Training AI Is Legal Now?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 25, 2025
A recent ruling states that training AI on copyrighted materials is legal under fair use, which marks a significant shift for AI companies. However, a judge found that Anthropic, developer of Claude AI, knowingly used pirated books, prompting further legal scrutiny and potential financial liabilities.
59.)
Creative Commons Launches CC Signals Framework For Open AI Ecosystem
| TechCrunch.com | June 25, 2025
Nonprofit Creative Commons, which spearheaded the licensing movement that allows creators to share their works while retaining copyright, is now preparing for the AI era. On Wednesday, the organization announced the launch of a new project, CC signals, which will allow dataset holders to detail how their content can or cannot be reused by machines, as in the case of training AI models.
60.)
Getty Images Drops Key Copyright Claims Against Stability AI, UK Lawsuit Continues
| TechCrunch.com | June 25, 2025
Getty Images dropped its primary claims of copyright infringement against Stability AI on Wednesday at London‚Äôs High Court, narrowing one of the most closely watched legal fights over how AI companies use copyrighted content to train their models.
61.)
Inworld AI Launches Inworld TTS For Scalable, Evolving Consumer Applications
| Inworld.ai | June 25, 2025
Today, we are launching Inworld TTS ‚Äì a new generation of text-to-speech models that deliver cutting-edge quality and latency for the most accessible price on the market. Our flagship model Inworld TTS-1 offers realistic, context-aware speech synthesis and precise zero-shot voice cloning, outperforming comparable solutions from leading labs.
62.)
Napster Launches Real-Time Video Chat Tools With Embodied AI Assistants
| GamesBeat.com | June 25, 2025
Napster announced two new AI products: the Napster Companion conversational AI platform with intelligent agents; and Napster View, a 3D second-screen device for two-way spatial conversations.
63.)
Ring Launches AI-Powered Video Descriptions To Identify Camera Activity For Users
| Zdnet.com | June 25, 2025
Called Video Descriptions, the AI feature generates detailed descriptions of what your Ring camera sees and delivers it in your notifications.
64.)
Google Gemini Update For Android Improves App Access While Enhancing Privacy Controls
| Androidpolice.com | June 25, 2025
Google Gemini in itself is powerful, but on Android, you must manually enable Apps ‚Äî think of them as extensions ‚Äî to make the AI chatbot even more powerful. Google currently offers several Apps for Gemini, such as Phone, Messages, Utilities, Workspace, and more. Now, in a move that should help assuage some privacy concerns, the company is sending out emails informing users that they can now access some of these extensions even if they have Gemini Apps Activity turned off.
65.)
Sam Altman Talks The NYT Lawsuit, Meta‚Äôs Talent Poaching, And Trump On AI
| Hard Fork | YouTube.com | June 25, 2025
This week, we present a clip from our first ever Hard Fork Live! Sam Altman and Brad Lightcap, CEO and COO of OpenAI, joined us on stage in front of a crowd of more than 600 people to talk about building A.I. hardware, OpenAI‚Äôs relationship to Microsoft and Meta, and A.I. and jobs.
66.)
Alphagenome By Deepmind Launches AI Model For Advanced Genome Variant Prediction
| Deepmind.google | June 25, 2025
